resources.string: Interested in how many times a day you look at your phone? Check out this app - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=%s!
Tap to see screen look and unlock counts.

It is simply for monitoring how many times you looked at your phone, as well as actually unlocked it. Counters reset every day (after 24h) and have a value of 0 at the beginning of using the app (as no data was yet gathered).

You can delete all the data by choosing Clear All Data option from the Action Bar on top. There are two other options, Share with Friends and Rate this app.

Big red circle shows how many times a day the screen was turned on. The counter resets every 24h. Tapping on a circle brings a calendar with a history of screen views. Just swipe the calendar from top to bottom or vise versa, in order to switch months.

Smaller yellow circle shows how many times a day the screen was unlocked. Typically, the value is smaller than screen views. The counter resets every 24h. Tapping on a circle brings a calendar with a history of screen unlocks. Just swipe the calendar from top to bottom or vise versa, in order to switch months.
Hi! My name is Tonia and I wrote this app :) Share your thoughts with me - I\'ll gladly answer the questions or implement changes. Thanks for using Look Counter!
Check the source code of this app on GitHub. You can grab pieces you like, suggest improvements, and report bugs.
